attributes.action: stop bonuses to be paid to staff of Royal Bank of Scotland despite government assurances that City pay would be curbed.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The bank is reported to have set aside £1.79 billion to cover "staff costs" for the first six months of the year alone in its investment banking division, including discretionary bonuses. This is unacceptable in the current economic climate and smacks of further greed by banks. Full disclosure must be made of each and very penny to be paid and subsequently bar all bonuses after the disclosure made. This should apply to all other banks bailed out

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
